commitResults.messageBody:
# Conflicts:
#	data/bob.txt
#	src/main/java/bob/Event.java

# Conflicts:

commitResults.messageTitle: Add checkstyle plugin and fix style errors
Edit showTasksFound method in Ui class to use Java varargs
The TaskList class does not currently validate assumptions about task list size after adding or removing tasks, which could lead to undetected bugs during development.
commitResults.messageBody:
Without assertions, there is no immediate check on the expected
behaviour of task list operations. This could allow incorrect task
management logic to go unnoticed, leading to potential runtime errors
or logical inconsistencies.

Add assertions in the addToDo and deleteTask methods to verify that the
task list size changes as expected after adding or removing tasks.
Also, include an assertion to check that the phrase length for a to-do
task is valid before proceeding with task creation.

Assertions are used to document assumptions and catch errors during the
development phase. By ensuring that these conditions are met, we can
prevent logical errors from propagating and ensure the integrity of the
task list operations.

commitResults.messageTitle: Currently, the task-saving process uses a traditional for-each loop to write tasks to a file, leading to more verbose code.
commitResults.messageBody:
This needs to change because the code can be made more concise and
expressive by leveraging Java's Streams API, which allows for a more
functional and readable approach to transforming collections.

Refactor the save method to use streams to map tasks to their string
representations and collect them into a single output for the file
writer.

This is done to enhance readability, eliminate manual iteration, and
provide a more declarative way to handle collections in Java. The
Streams API is more efficient and idiomatic for tasks like these.

commitResults.messageTitle: The file existence checks in the load and save methods are written directly inside if conditions, making the code less readable and slightly harder to maintain.
commitResults.messageBody:
Refactoring the conditions into separate boolean variables improves
readability and makes the logic easier to understand, debug, and
maintain in the future. This structure also reduces repetition within
the methods and provides clarity in understanding which conditions are
being checked.

Extract boolean expressions for checking file and directory existence
into named variables (directoryFileExists, directoryExists, fileExists,
and isRegularFile). This clarifies the logic and organizes the code for
better readability and maintainability.

By separating the conditions into clearly named variables, we ensure
that the logic is easy to follow and modify. It also promotes clean
code practices by reducing complex conditional expressions.
Add assertions to TaskList class
Use streams in Save method
Improve code readability in Storage class

commitResults.messageTitle: Add in new task type - Fixed, which accommodates tasks with no deadline but have a fixed duration to complete
Rename boolean variable found to isFound in searchKeyword method
commitResults.messageBody:
searchKeyword method uses found as a boolean variable - uses unclear
naming for boolean values

Boolean variables should have names that indicate true/false values
more clearly.

Rename found to isFound for better clarity and adherence to boolean
naming conventions.

This change improves readability and aligns with standard coding
practices for boolean variable names.

The constructor in the TaskList class accepts an existing list of tasks.

This constructor is currently not being used in the codebase.

Remove the constructor to eliminate unused code and simplify the
TaskList class.

By removing this unused constructor, we ensure the codebase remains
clean, maintainable, and free of unnecessary functionality.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove showLine method from Ui class
commitResults.messageBody:
The showLine method in the Ui class returns a horizontal line for
formatting output.

This method is redundant and no longer contributes to the UI's
functionality.

Remove the showLine method to clean up the UI class and avoid
unnecessary methods.

By removing this method, we streamline the UI class, ensuring that only
relevant and essential functionality is retained.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove getWelcomeMessage method from Bob class
commitResults.messageBody:
The getWelcomeMessage method in the Bob class provides a welcome
message when the chatbot starts.

This method is redundant because a similar method exists in the Ui
class, which already handles welcome messages.

Remove the getWelcomeMessage method from the Bob class to avoid
duplication and rely on the method in the Ui class for consistency.

By removing this method, we maintain a single source of truth for
displaying welcome messages and reduce code redundancy.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove getGoodbyeMessage method from Bob class
commitResults.messageBody:
The getGoodbyeMessage method in the Bob class provides a goodbye
message when the user exits the chatbot.

This method is redundant because a similar method exists in the Ui
class, which already handles goodbye messages.

Remove the getGoodbyeMessage method from the Bob class to avoid
duplication and use the method in the Ui class for consistency.

This reduces code redundancy and ensures that the farewell messages are
managed centrally in the Ui class.

Currently, there is no user guide in the projectâ€™s documentation, which
leaves users unclear on how to interact with the Bob chatbot.

This needs to change to ensure that users have clear instructions on
how to use the chatbot, including its commands and features.

Add a detailed user guide under the README, outlining key features like
adding tasks, marking tasks, finding tasks, and exiting Bob. Provide
instructions for different task types, task management, and usage
examples.

This is done to help users easily understand and navigate the
functionalities of Bob, improving overall user experience.

commitResults.messageTitle: Set application window title to "Bob Chatbot"
commitResults.messageBody:
The application window currently displays no title, making it unclear
what the window represents.

This needs to change so that users can easily identify the application
they are interacting with.

Set the title of the primary stage to "Bob Chatbot."

It ensures clarity and enhances the user's experience by showing the
chatbot's name in the title bar.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bug by including isDone in Fixed constructor's super call
commitResults.messageBody:
The Fixed constructor does not reference the isDone
parameter when calling the superclass constructor, causing fixed
tasks to always be read as unmarked.

This needs to change to correctly reflect the completion status of
fixed tasks.

Include the isDone parameter in the call to the superclass
constructor.

It ensures that the fixed tasks correctly maintain and display their
completion status.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add screenshot of Bob Chatbot UI to user guide
commitResults.messageBody:
The user guide does not currently include a visual representation of
the Bob Chatbot UI.

Including a screenshot helps users visualize the application's
interface and understand its features better.

Add a representative screenshot of the Bob Chatbot UI to the user guide.

It enhances the documentation by providing a clear view of the user
interface, making it more informative and user-friendly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update user guide to replace * with ! emoji for emphasis
commitResults.messageBody:
The user guide uses * for emphasis in Feature section, which can be
less noticeable.

Replace * with the ! emoji to improve the visibility of important
notes.

Replace * with the ! emoji in the user guide to highlight crucial
information regarding date formatting.

It improves readability and draws more attention to important details,
enhancing user experience.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update user guide to use * for italicization instead of _
commitResults.messageBody:
The user guide uses _ for italicizing text, which does not work as
intended in Markdown.

_ does not italicize in Markdown, hence not achieving the intended
formatting.

Change _ to * to ensure proper italicization of text in the user guide.

Adjust italicization in the user guide to use * instead of _ to
correctly format text and improve readability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update user guide to not use italicization
commitResults.messageBody:
The user guide uses * for italicizing text, which does not work as
intended in Markdown.

* does not italicize in Markdown, hence not achieving the intended
formatting.

Remove the instance of italicization in the user guide.

Remove usage of italicization to remove instances of * that could
mislead readers and affect readability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix date formatting display in user guide
commitResults.messageBody:
The user guide currently uses angle brackets <date> and
<yyyy-MM-dd HHmm> for date formatting instructions.

Angle brackets do not render properly in Markdown, causing the
instructions to appear incorrectly.

Replace angle brackets with quoting codes (`<date>` and
`<yyyy-MM-dd HHmm>`) to ensure proper display.

This change improves readability and ensures that formatting
instructions are clear and accurate, enhancing user understanding and
adherence to the date formatting guidelines.
